questions.title: Advanced Persistent Threats
questions.prompt: Explain what Advanced Persistent Threats (APTs) are and their typical characteristics.
followups: How do APTs typically maintain persistence in a network?
What are some common indicators of APT activity?

questions.title: Kerberos Authentication
questions.prompt: Walk through the Kerberos authentication protocol step by step.
followups: What are the weaknesses of Kerberos that attackers often exploit?
How does Golden Ticket attack work against Kerberos?

questions.title: Memory Corruption Exploits
questions.prompt: Explain how Return-Oriented Programming (ROP) chains work to bypass DEP.
followups: What are gadgets in the context of ROP?
How does Control Flow Integrity help prevent ROP attacks?

questions.title: Cloud Security Shared Responsibility
questions.prompt: Explain the shared responsibility model in cloud security for IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS.
followups: How does security responsibility shift between different cloud service models?
What are common security misconfigurations in cloud environments?

questions.title: Reverse Engineering Malware
questions.prompt: Describe the process and tools used for reverse engineering a suspicious executable.
followups: What are the differences between static and dynamic analysis?
How do you safely analyze malware in a controlled environment?

questions.title: Blockchain Security
questions.prompt: Explain the security model of blockchain and common vulnerabilities in smart contracts.
followups: What is a 51% attack and how does it threaten blockchain security?
How do reentrancy attacks work in smart contracts?

questions.title: Container Security
questions.prompt: What are the main security considerations for containerized environments like Docker and Kubernetes?
followups: How do you secure container images throughout their lifecycle?
What are the security implications of container breakout vulnerabilities?

questions.title: ICS/SCADA Security
questions.prompt: Explain the unique security challenges of Industrial Control Systems and SCADA networks.
followups: Why are traditional IT security solutions often inadequate for ICS environments?
What was the attack vector in the Stuxnet attack?

questions.title: Quantum Computing Threats
questions.prompt: Explain how quantum computing threatens current cryptographic algorithms.
followups: Which current encryption algorithms are vulnerable to quantum attacks?
What are post-quantum cryptography algorithms?

questions.title: Advanced Phishing Techniques
questions.prompt: Describe advanced phishing techniques like homograph attacks and adversary-in-the-middle frameworks.
followups: How do attackers bypass multi-factor authentication in sophisticated phishing attacks?
What is a reverse proxy phishing kit and how does it work?

questions.title: Threat Hunting Methodology
questions.prompt: Explain the process of proactive threat hunting in an enterprise environment.
followups: What are some common hypotheses that drive threat hunting?
How do you differentiate between normal behavior and malicious activity?

questions.title: Supply Chain Attacks
questions.prompt: Explain what software supply chain attacks are and how they can be prevented.
followups: What was the attack vector in the SolarWinds breach?
How can Software Bill of Materials (SBOM) help mitigate supply chain risks?

questions.title: Active Directory Attacks
questions.prompt: Describe common attack techniques against Active Directory environments.
followups: How does the DCSync attack work and what privileges are needed?
What are some best practices for securing Active Directory?

questions.title: Web Application Firewall Evasion
questions.prompt: Explain techniques attackers use to bypass Web Application Firewalls (WAFs).
followups: What is obfuscation and how is it used to evade WAFs?
How can rate limiting help prevent WAF bypass attempts?

questions.title: Deception Technology
questions.prompt: Explain how deception technology works and its role in modern security architectures.
followups: What are honeypots and how do they differ from honeytokens?
How can deception technology help with early threat detection?
